Posts.Content: Mar 7, 2008 07:57AM dancer51 wrote: Miss S, My first treatment was awful and I was down for most of the time also.  I'm sorry to hear that you are so sick.  They gave me Emend before the treatment and one thing I didn't have was stomach sickness.  They also changed my treatment to AC instead of AC+T. I"ll do taxol separately.  3 of AC and 4 of taxol.  I'm so glad I found this.  Someone out there tell me I can do this and get through it.

Posts.Content: dancer51 wrote: Hi Everyone,                          I'm glad I found this site.  I'm not coping well with all of this.  I had a bilateral mast with lymph node resectioning in Dec. and had my first chemo end of Jan. (AC+T) ended up with seroma and had to have a minor surgery to drain, irrigate, and culture my right chest area.   I don't like the center I'm going to.  I feel like a number not a person and I'm so tired of thinking cancer!  I'm a person first.  I'm looking for another center where they treat the whole person not just the disease.  I haven't gone back for another treatment and I know I have to do this.   I'm sorry if I sound frustrated but I'm jumping out of my skin with stress.   Thanks for listening Dx 10/21/2007, IDC, 6cm+, Stage IIIB, Grade 3, 2/8 nodes, ER-/PR-, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Anxious and Nervous dancer51 dancer51

Posts.Content: Mar 7, 2008 07:42AM dancer51 wrote: Hi MissShapen,  Your words are very kind and encouraging.  I beleived I'm right now more stressed out over the fact that I'm procrastinating on the treatment than the cancer itself.  Please share your chemo experience with me.  Thank you again.  Sometimes I feel so all alone.
